definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to smell/to sniff sth out/to perceive by smelling
obscure and unknown (idiom); an outsider without any reputation/a nobody/an unknown quantity
to love to hear and see (idiom)/well received/to one's liking
State Council Information Office of the People's Republic of China
pinyin: Guo2 wu4 yuan4 Xin1 wen2 Ban4 gong1 shi4

sentences.english: They are the first to smell the sweet new grasses and the willow catkins.
sentences.chinese: 他們是聞甜的新草和柳樹柳絮花的第一。

sentences.english: The other half smelt a more neutral-smelling T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 另一半聞的是無氣味的T恤。

sentences.english: In the past, I had particularly loved her smell.
sentences.chinese: 過去，我特別喜愛聞她身上飄散出來的味道。

sentences.english: Sniffed it with pleasure then clinked his glass to hers.
sentences.chinese: 先高興的聞了聞，再舉起杯和瑪麗莎碰了碰。

sentences.english: Sniffed it with pleasure then clinked his glass to hers.
sentences.chinese: 先高興的聞了聞，再舉起杯和瑪麗莎碰了碰。

sentences.english: We could smell the dinner cooking in the next room.
sentences.chinese: 我們可聞得到隔壁房間燒菜的味道。

sentences.english: Why are you smelling the fish?
Long rain soon cleared up singing, smell.
sentences.chinese: 久雨聞鳥鳴，不久即轉晴。

sentences.english: "You how can anybody know do I live here?"The Yue smells the cherry querying.
sentences.chinese: “你怎麼知道我住在這裏的？”嶽聞櫻問。

sentences.english: If there are beings who hear this teaching, they should aspire to be born in that land.
sentences.chinese: 若有衆生，聞是說者，應當發願，生彼國土。

sentences.english: “Smell the air,” I said. I mimed inhaling deeply.
sentences.chinese: “聞一下，”我說，做出深深吸氣的樣子。

sentences.english: Smelling is an important part of evaluating tea.
sentences.chinese: 聞是評價茶的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: Men who had sniffed real tears had less activity in parts of the brain linked to sexual excitement.
sentences.chinese: 聞真實眼淚的男性與性興奮相關的腦部區域較不活躍。

sentences.english: Her physical examination was remarkable for bilateral crackles in the lung bases.
sentences.chinese: 體格檢查在雙肺底部可聞明顯的雜音。

sentences.english: It's very dark. There's nothing can see on the Li river, but we can hear the beacher clearly.
sentences.chinese: 天還很黑，灕江上什麼都看不到，浪聲卻清晰可聞。

sentences.english: My fingers are extra fishy today, if you care to take a whiff.
sentences.chinese: 我的手指今天特別腥，不知道你想不想聞一下。

definition: feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
